description.plain: Edward Sharpe and the Magnetic Zeros formed in 2007 after singer Alex Ebert met fellow singer Jade Castrinos outside of Little Pedro’s in downtown Los Angeles. In 2009 the 10-member troupe released their debut album, Up From Below, which featured the hit “Home” as well as fan favorites “40 Day Dream” and “Janglin”. The band has spent the past few years touring the world while winning over audiences at festivals like Coachella, Bonnaroo, Lollapalooza, Leeds, Austin City Limits and more. Their follow up album, Here, was released in May 2012 and featured the tracks “Man On Fire” and “That’s What’s Up.” The album debuted at #1 on the Independent Music Chart and #5 on Billboard Top 200 Chart the week after its release. Relix Magazine hailed it as “an album full of undeniable folk-rock hooks, gospel overtones, infectious lyrics, orchestral swells and a whole lot of love.” Entertainment Weekly declared, “…they’ve got so much heart, they can crush hipster irony with one squeeze of the accordion.” The album was listed at number seven on Rolling Stone’s “Best Albums of 2012″ List.

body.plain: Edward Sharpe and the Magnetic Zeros formed in 2007 after singer Alex Ebert met fellow singer Jade Castrinos outside of Little Pedro’s in downtown Los Angeles. Their follow up album, Here, was released in May 2012 and featured the tracks “Man On Fire” and “That’s What’s Up.” The album debuted at #1 on the Independent Music Chart and #5 on Billboard Top 200 Chart the week after its release. Relix Magazine hailed it as “an album full of undeniable folk-rock hooks, gospel overtones, infectious lyrics, orchestral swells and a whole lot of love.” Entertainment Weekly declared, “…they’ve got so much heart, they can crush hipster irony with one squeeze of the accordion.” The album was listed at number seven on Rolling Stone’s “Best Albums of 2012″ List.

songs.full_title: Home by Edward Sharpe & The Magnetic Zeros
songs.title: Home

description.plain:
This country folk song released in 2010 initially had modest commercial success on the US Billboard Alternative Songs chart, reaching number 25.
After fronting a Peugeot car commercial in 2013, it reached number 7 on the singles chart of France (compiled by Syndicat national de l'édition phonographique).

songs.lyrics:
65 ContributorsHome Lyrics[Verse 1: Jade Castrinos & Alexander]
Alabama, Arkansas, I do love my Ma and Pa
Not the way that I do love you
Well, holy moly, me oh my, you're the apple of my eye
Girl, I never loved one like you
Man, oh, man, you're my best friend, I scream it to the nothingness
There ain't nothing that I need
Well, hot and heavy pumpkin pie
Chocolate candy, Jesus Christ
There ain't nothing please me more than you
[Chorus: Jade Castrinos & Alexander]
Oh, home, let me come home
Home is whenever I'm with you
Oh, home, let me come home
Home is whenever I'm with you

[Post-Chorus: Jade Castrinos & Alexander]
La-la-la-la, take me home
Honey (Mother), I'm coming home

[Verse 2: Jade Castrinos, Alexander & Both]
I'll follow you into the park
Through the jungle, through the dark
Girl, I never loved one like you
Moats and boats and waterfalls, alleyways and pay phone calls
I been everywhere with you (Hey, that's true)
Laugh until we think we'll die, barefoot on a summer night
Never could be sweeter than with you
And in the streets, you run a-free, like it's only you and me
Geez, you're something to see

[Chorus: Jade Castrinos & Alexander]
Oh, home, let me come home
Home is whenever I'm with you
Oh, home, let me come home
Home is wherever I'm with you
You might also like[Post-Chorus: Jade Castrinos & Alexander]
La-la-la-la, take me home
Daddy, I'm coming home

[Bridge Spoken: Jade Castrinos & Alexander]
Jade? Alexander?
Do you remember that day you fell outta my window?
I sure do ‒ you came jumping out after me!
Well, you fell on the concrete and nearly broke your ass
And you were bleeding all over the place
And I rushed you out to the hospital, you remember that?
Yes, I do
Well there's something I never told you about that night
What didn't you tell me?
While you were sitting in the back seat
Smoking a cigarette you thought was gonna be your last
I was falling deep, deeply in love with you
And I never told you 'til just now!
Aww!

[Chorus: Jade Castrinos & Alexander]
Oh, home, let me come home
Home is whenever I'm with you
Oh, home, let me come home
Home is where I'm alone with you
[Outro: Jade Castrinos & Alexander]
Home, let me come home
Home is wherever I'm with you
Oh, home, yes, I am home
Home is when I'm alone with you

Alabama, Arkansas
I do love my Ma and Pa
Moats and boats and waterfalls
Alleyways and payphone calls

(Oh, home) Home
(Oh, home) Home
Home is wherever I'm with you
(Oh, home) Home
(Oh, home) Home
Home is when I'm alone with you53Embed

songs.full_title: That's What's Up by Edward Sharpe & The Magnetic Zeros
songs.title: That’s What’s Up

description.plain:
From the album “Here”

This song seems to be about someones lover who is also their best friend. Much like the song “You’re My Best Friend” by Queen
